revised_title: Investigation of Sodium-Ethyl and Potassium-Ethyl Formation
tldr: Edward Frankland investigates the formation of sodium-ethyl and potassium-ethyl and finds that they cannot be obtained by the action of sodium on iodide of ethyl. The decomposition of iodide of ethyl by sodium-ethyl produces hydride of ethyl and olefiant gas, suggesting a new approach to forming hydrogen compounds of highly positive metals.
